TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FlowDirection extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines constants that specify the content flow direction for text and user interface (UI) elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The flow direction of content typically corresponds to the innate flow direction of the language being represented. Hebrew and Arabic provide examples of languages that naturally flow from right-to-left. English, German, and Russian provide examples of languages that naturally flow from left-to-right.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection> enumeration to set the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block.FlowDirection%2A> attribute of a flow content <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> element (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph>).
[!code-xaml[BlockSnippets#_Block_FlowDirectionXAML](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BlockSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml#_block_flowdirectionxaml)]
The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection> enumeration programmatically.
[!code-csharp[BlockSnippets#_Block_FlowDirection](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BlockSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#_block_flowdirection)] [!code-vb[BlockSnippets#_Block_FlowDirection](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BlockSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#_block_flowdirection)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.FlowDirection LeftToRight = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that content should flow from left to right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.FlowDirection RightToLeft = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that content should flow from right to left.
